sentences: Zdzisław Jachimecki (Lwów, 7 July 1882 – 27 October 1953, Kraków) was a Polish historian of music, composer, professor at the Jagiellonian University and the Kraków Music Academy, and member of the Polish Academy of Learning.
Born in Lwów in 1882, in 1904–5 he studied counterpoint with Arnold Schönberg in Vienna.
Artega i Wagner jako teoretycy dramatu muzycznego (1912)
Mikołaj Gomółka i jego poprzednicy w historii muzyki polskiej (1946)
